data.title: Music
data.meta_description: Terraria has over ninety music tracks across every version of the game. Each one will play and loop endlessly while the player is in a specific biome or while certain events are taking place. Music is individual to each player, and as such its volume can be lowered or disabled entirely within the settings menu.
data.text:
# Title Condition[1] Album Version Listen Description 1 Overworld Day

Forest, daytime

Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Overworld_Day.mp3 It is a cheerful, upbeat, and simple tune. 2 Eerie

Blood Moon

Meteorite

Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Eerie.mp3 It is slower and more sinister than most other tracks. On Nintendo 3DS version, replaced by Underworld. At release, it also played in Corruption, Dungeon, and Underworld. 3 Overworld Night

Forest, night-time

The Hallow (surface), night-time

Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Overworld_Night.mp3 It is relatively peaceful and relaxing, but its tune is a minor one. 4 Underground

Cavern

Underground

Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underground.mp3 It is a fast and whimsical track, with an almost robotic tone. 5 Boss 1

Eater of Worlds

Eye of Cthulhu

King Slime

Lepus(3DS version)

Skeletron

Skeletron Prime

Turkor the Ungrateful(3DS version)

Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_1.mp3 Loud and frantic battle music. Also played for Duke Fishron before 1.4.0.1, and on Old-gen console for the Goblin Army. 6 Title Screen

Title screen

Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Title_Screen.mp3 A serene, solemn tune, but short and hooking, this was played on the main menu before it was replaced with Journey's Beginning. It still plays in-game when the sun or moon is dragged. 7 Jungle

Jungle, surface, daytime

Vol. 1 1.0.5 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Jungle.mp3 An exotic, relaxed tune, it has a unique feel to it with a heavy emphasis on percussion. 8 Corruption

The Corruption (surface)

Don't dig up world generation

Vol. 1 1.0.6 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Corruption.mp3 Its melody somewhat resembles the Overworld Day track but altered and slowed to sound much darker and more menacing. 9 The Hallow

The Hallow (surface), daytime

Vol. 1 1.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-The_Hallow.mp3 It has a very happy, heavenly tone and makes use of instruments related to this idea, especially the harp. It shares a lot of its melody with Overworld Day. 10 Underground Corruption

Underground Corruption

Vol. 1 1.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Corruption.mp3 This track is a combination of Corruption and Underground tracks, with a depressing and dark tone. 11 Underground Hallow

Underground Hallow

Celebrationmk10 world generation

Lepus

Vol. 1 1.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Hallow.mp3 This track is a combination of the Hallow and Underground tracks. It shares the heavenly tone of the Hallow tracks, but with a faster-paced, electronic tune. 12 Boss 2

The Twins

Wall of Flesh

Vol. 1 1.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_2.mp3 It is a very hectic, frantic tune, and gives the feel of a chase, fear and horror, especially at the beginning. 13 Boss 3

Brain of Cthulhu

Frost Legion

The Destroyer

The Torch God(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions)

Vol. 1 1.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_3.mp3 It is much slower and less intense than the other boss fights, the slowest track in the soundtrack, giving it a more menacing and mechanical tone, suiting most of the situations it plays in (e.g in the boss fights between Brain of Cthulhu and The Destroyer). 14 Ice/Snow

Snow biome

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Snow.mp3 A relaxed, somewhat slow-paced theme with a distinct, cold, and crystalline feel. Originally introduced on Old-gen console as "Ice", it was later renamed "Snow" since the desktop version introduced its own "Ice" theme. 15 Space Night

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Space[2], night-time

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Space_Night.mp3 A quick and carefree theme that makes use of many airy synths and shares some of its instruments with the Overworld Day theme. Contains a motif of Underground. 16 Crimson

The Crimson (surface)

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Crimson.mp3 An unnerving, dark, and unsettling theme with a faster pace than that of the Corruption. Its main melody comes near the end of the track. 17 Golem/Boss 4

Golem

Lunatic Cultist(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions)[3]

(Old-gen console version) Pirate Invasion

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Golem.mp3 Fast paced without being particularly dark or menacing. 18 Alternate Day

Forest, daytime

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Alternate_Day.mp3 A cheerful, upbeat tune similar to the Overworld Day theme, but with a more complex composition. 19 Rain

Rain

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Rain.mp3 It gives the effect of a peaceful and calming theme, slower and less upbeat than others. 20 Ice/Underground Ice

Ice biome

Vol. 4 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Ice_biome.mp3 A calm, mysterious, and wintery theme slightly reminiscent of the Alternate Underground theme. 21 Desert

Desert

Vol. 4 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Desert.mp3 It is a simple, quiet theme inspired by ancient Egyptian music as commonly portrayed in other video games and films. Originally introduced on Old-gen console. Replaced the Overworld Day theme in this biome. 22 Ocean

Ocean, daytime

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Ocean_Day.mp3 It is a tranquil theme with a somewhat slower pace than other daytime themes. 23 Dungeon

Dungeon

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Dungeon.mp3 A sinister, dark theme that makes use of various instruments to evoke a sound akin to the echoes of a deep dungeon below. 24 Plantera

Plantera

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Plantera.mp3 It is a unique, fast rock track with a metal tune and prominent use of electric guitars, and has some melodies from the Jungle soundtrack. As a nod to Cenx's favorite band, Pantera, parts of the track have a similar sound to the end of "Domination" from the album Cowboys from Hell. 25 Queen Bee/Boss 5

Eye of Cthulhu

Ocram(Old-gen console and 3DS versions)

Queen Bee

Vol. 4 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_5.mp3 It is a frenetic, serious theme, which uses sounds resembling bee buzzes and wing hovering. Originally introduced on Old-gen console as "Boss 4", it was later renamed "Boss 5", since the Desktop version already had its own "Boss 4" theme. 26 Lihzahrd/Temple

Jungle Temple[4]

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Lihzahrd.mp3 A mysterious and exotic-sounding theme, feeling like being in an ancient world. 27 Eclipse

Solar Eclipse

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Eclipse.mp3 It is dark with a varying pace, featuring an organ to give it a classic horror feel. Also played during Pumpkin Moon before 1.2.1.2. 28 Rain ambience

Rain

Thunderstorm

n/a 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:28_RainAmbience.wav The sounds of rain pattering on the ground with slight hints of distant thunder. 29 Mushrooms

Glowing Mushroom biome

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Mushrooms.mp3 An offbeat, exotic, and trippy piece. 30 Pumpkin Moon

Pumpkin Moon

Vol. 3 1.2.1.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Pumpkin_Moon.mp3 Spooky Halloween-themed music. Replaced the Eclipse theme for this event. 31 Alternate Underground

Cavern

Underground

Vol. 3 1.2.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Alternate_Underground.mp3 It has a different, less whimsical feel than the original Underground theme. It also contains a Boss 2 motif near the end of the song. 32 Frost Moon

Frost Moon

Vol. 3 1.2.2 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Frost_Moon.mp3 It vaguely resembles a Christmas song but is more upbeat and uses an electric guitar with a heavy distortion applied giving it a metal feel to the track. 33 Underground Crimson

Underground Crimson

Vol. 3 1.2.4 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Crimson.mp3 A mix of the Underground and Crimson tracks. 34 Lunar Boss/The Towers

Lunar Events

Vol. 2

Vol. 3

1.3.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Lunar_Boss.mp3 A fast, abstract, and especially intense theme. Originally intended for the final boss, in the two years between the album's release and the introduction of the track in-game, plans had changed. Its album name would be used for the Moon Lord theme. 35 Pirate Invasion

Pirate Invasion

Vol. 3 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Pirate_Invasion.mp3 Somewhat reminiscent of the Pirates of the Caribbean soundtrack. Replaced the Golem/Boss 4 theme for this event. 36 Underworld

The Underworld

Vol. 3 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underworld.mp3 A deep and menacing track, with an emphasis on harsh percussion. Replaced Eerie theme for this biome. On the Nintendo 3DS version, this theme replaces all instances of Eerie. 37 Martian Madness

Martian Madness

Vol. 3 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Martian_Madness.mp3 A loud, daunting track. Originally released as a 1.3 spoiler.[5] 38 Moon Lord/Lunar Boss

Moon Lord

Vol. 3 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Moon_Lord.mp3 A unique, intense track with a fast tempo. Reuses part of the Lunar Towers and Space themes. Called "Lunar Boss" in-game. 39 Goblin Army/Goblin Invasion

Goblin Army

Vol. 3 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Goblin_Army.mp3 (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) It somewhat vaguely resembles the Pumpkin Moon theme. Replaced "Boss 1" for this event. 40 Sandstorm

Sandstorm

Vol. 4 1.3.3 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Sandstorm.mp3 This track is a tense theme that uses a synth to simulate wind (along with actual wind sounds) as well as a sitar to give a sort of Egyptian desert feeling. Some parts of "Boss 5" and "The Towers" theme can be heard. 41 Old One's Army

Old One's Army

Vol. 4 1.3.4 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Old_One%27s_Army.mp3 An intense theme, more orchestral than most other Terraria songs, which incorporates bits from the main theme of Dungeon Defenders as well as Terraria tracks Pirate Invasion, Title, Goblin Army, and Pumpkin Moon. 42 Space Day

Space[2], daytime

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Space_Day.mp3 It has a slower and calmer feeling. Originally introduced on Old-gen console as "Space", before the Desktop version had its own Space theme added. On Old-gen console versions, it serves as an alternate Space theme, both having a 50% chance of playing regardless of time. 43 Ocean Night

Ocean, night-time

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Ocean_Night.mp3 This track is more active and bouncier than its daytime counterpart. It has a happy, peaceful sounding tone. Originally introduced on Old-gen console as "Ocean", before the Desktop version had its own Ocean theme added. On Old-gen console versions, it serves as an alternate Ocean theme, both having a 50% chance of playing regardless of time. 44 Windy Day/High Wind

Windy Day

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Windy_Day.mp3 A perky, cheerful, whimsical track, inspired by Winnie-the-Pooh[6]. It includes instruments such as music box, castanets and a tambourine, and is one of the few tracks in the game to not be in 4

4 time, rather it is in 3

4. 45 Wind ambiance

Windy Day

Thunderstorm

n/a 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:45_-_Wind_Ambiance.mp3 The sounds of wind blowing past. 46 Town Day

Town, daytime

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Town_Day.mp3 A soothing track with a slight resemblance to Overworld Day. 47 Town Night

Town, night-time

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Town_Night.mp3 It starts quickly and then slows down to reveal a calm and enjoyable melody. 48 Slime Rain

Slime Rain

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Slime_Rain.mp3 A bouncy, slightly silly-sounding track that plays during the event. It contains motifs of the Ocean Night and Underground themes. 49 Day Remix

Music Box-only

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Contest_Winner.mp3 This techno remix by Xenon and DSniper of the Overworld Day theme was the winning track of Terraria's music contest. 50 Journey's Beginning

(with intro)

Title screen

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Journey%27s_Beginning_(intro).mp3 A triumphant, powerful track that plays on the title screen. On game launch and in the 1.4 trailer it features a "whoom" intro sound before looping into the standard Journey's Beginning track. It is also the first track to be heard by a new player. 51 Journey's Beginning

Title screen

n/a 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Journey%27s_Beginning.mp3 A triumphant, powerful track that plays on the title screen. Internally referred to as "Title Alt". 52 Storm

Thunderstorm

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Storm.mp3 It sounds harsh and threatening, and has a slight resemblance to the Old One's Army and Sandstorm tracks. 53 Graveyard

Graveyard

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Graveyard.mp3 A dark, depressing spin on the Town themes. 54 Underground Jungle

Underground Jungle

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Jungle.mp3 Significantly less whimsical than the Surface Jungle tracks and sounds more threatening and melancholic. 55 Jungle Night

Jungle, surface, night-time

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Surface_Night_Jungle.mp3 It sounds very different from the day theme, with the main melody being a slow, ominous beat with an emphasis on deep drums. 56 Queen Slime

Queen Slime

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Queen_Slime.mp3 This track begins with a regal and celebratory style, before turning into something more sinister and methodical. It contains a motif of Jungle Night. 57 Empress of Light

Empress of Light

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Empress_of_Light.mp3 It begins as a fast, extremely intense track similar to Boss 2, before changing to a slower tune. The entire track has a very chaotic feel and sounds unlike anything else in Terraria. Uniquely, this track features a second loop with different composition, before completely looping. 58 Duke Fishron

Duke Fishron

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Duke_Fishron.mp3 A slow theme with bubbling sounds and a pirate-like feel, in stark contrast with the fast-paced and chaotic fight it accompanies. 59 Tutorial/Morning Rain

Rain, between 4:30 AM and 7:30 AM

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Morning_Rain.mp3 Very similar to the Overworld Day theme, but is significantly more extravagant and jolly, like one is about to embark on an adventure. Originally introduced on Old-gen console as the "Tutorial" theme. 60 Console Title/Alt Title

Drunk world generation

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Title_(Console).mp3 An extended variation of the Title Screen track, with more instruments and expression. Originally introduced on Old-gen console as the "Title Screen". 61 Underground Desert

Underground Desert

Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Desert.mp3 It begins as a slow, mysterious theme featuring strings and low tones, before it transitions into a rock-style theme, with guitars and heavy drums, similar to the Plantera track. 62 Rain (Otherworldly)

(Prelude)

Rain, daytime

Thunderstorm

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Rain_(Otherworldly).mp3 An atmospheric track with light piano sounds that brings the image of falling rain. 63 Overworld Day (Otherworldly)

(Every Adventure Has A Beginning)

Forest, daytime

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Forest_Day_(Otherworldly).mp3 A celebratory, almost victoriously sounding track which features instruments like Irish flute for a fantasy feeling. 64 Night (Otherworldly)

(Night Falls, Darkness Emerges)

Forest, night-time

Rain, night-time

The Hallow, night-time

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Forest_Night_(Otherworldly).mp3 It is an ominous, at times frantic track that gives a sense of impending danger. 65 Underground (Otherworldly)

(Below the Surface)

Cavern

Underground

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Main_Theme_(Underground)_(Otherworldly).mp3 A heroic-sounding track which features violin. Its internal name is "Music-Main Theme (Underground)" which suggests it was meant as a title screen track, which in turn fits with its grand intro. 66 Desert (Otherworldly)

(Secret of the Sands)

Desert

Sandstorm

Underground Desert

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Desert_(Otherworldly).mp3 It begins with dobro (or similarly sounding instrument) for a Wild West-feeling, along with occasional heartbeats. It continues with Irish flute for a fantasy feeling, and ends with subtle female vocals. 67 Ocean (Otherworldly)

(Enchanted Blue)

Ocean

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Ocean_(Otherworldly).mp3 An ambient-like track which incorporates pan flute music to produce the image of distant shores. 68 Mushrooms (Otherworldly)

(Celestial Caverns)

Glowing Mushroom biome

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Crystal_Caves_(Mushrooms)_(Otherworldly).mp3 It resembles a more tranquil version of the regular mushroom biome track. Its internal name is "Music-Crystal Caves (Mushrooms)" which suggests it would also play in some Gemstone cave-like biome. 69 Dungeon (Otherworldly)

(Ancient Citadel)

Dungeon

Jungle Temple[4]

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Dungeon_(Otherworldly).mp3 It is a melancholic and ritualistic-feeling track which features chanting and tribal-like drums. 70 Space (Otherworldly)

(The Endless Void)

Space

Get fixed boi world generation

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Space_(Otherworldly).mp3 An ambient track which subtly features "psychedelic" sounds for a sci-fi feeling and gradually grows to a heroic sound. 71 Underworld (Otherworldly)

(Journey to the Core)

The Underworld

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underworld_(Otherworldly).mp3 Dark, aggressive, and features harpsichord music for a "haunted house" feeling. 72 Snow (Otherworldly)

(Glimmers of Vibrance)

Snow biome

The Aether

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Arctic_(Snow)_(Otherworldly).mp3 A calm and relaxing track which shifts between what resembles uplifting trance music and fantasy music. 73 Corruption (Otherworldly)

(Shadows of Corruption)

The Corruption (surface)

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Corruption_(Otherworldly).mp3 It is a dark, undulating track which features downtempo rock music. 74 Underground Corruption (Otherworldly)

(Decay and Corrosion)

Underground Corruption

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Corruption_(Otherworldly).mp3 Resembles its Otherworld surface counterpart, but is somewhat more aggressive. 75 Crimson (Otherworldly)

(Blood Crawlers)

The Crimson (surface)

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Crimson_(Otherworldly).mp3 A dark, ambient track which seems to feature some type of contrabass brass instrument for a "gloomy" feeling and eventually becomes almost psychedelic-sounding. 76 Underground Crimson (Otherworldly)

(Crimson Chasm)

Underground Crimson

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Crimson_(Otherworldly).mp3 A brooding and increasingly frantic track. 77 Ice (Otherworldly)

(A Sweet Menace)

Ice biome

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Ice_(Otherworldly).mp3 It has a "crystalline" and rather ominous sound to it. 78 Underground Hallow (Otherworldly)

(Twisted Virtue)

Underground Hallow

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Hallow_(Otherworldly).mp3 A sinister track that seems to involve different percussion instruments as well as a music box styled instrumentation to evoke a sense of sinister whimsy. 81 Boss 1 (Otherworldly)

(Behold the OctoEye)

Brain of Cthulhu

Eater of Worlds

Eye of Cthulhu

King Slime

Mechdusa

Queen Bee

Skeletron

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_1_(Otherworldly).mp3 Somewhat resembles the regular Old One's Army track, but with a darker feeling. 82 Invasion (Otherworldly)

(Fighting Off the Invasion)

Frost Legion

Frost Moon

Goblin Army

Martian Madness

Old One's Army

Pirate Invasion

Pumpkin Moon

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Invasion_(Otherworldly).mp3 A menacing, "rapid" track which gives a sense of running out of time. 83 The Towers (Otherworldly)

(Fighting the Night)

Lunar Events

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-The_Towers_(Otherworldly).mp3 Somewhat heroic-sounding, and features chanting as well as ample amounts of electric guitar. 84 Lunar Boss (Otherworldly)

(Consumed by Darkness)

Moon Lord

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Lunar_Boss_(Otherworldly).mp3 Resembles The Towers track but has more chanting and feels even more dramatic, as is appropriate with the Moon Lord appearing after the Lunar Event. 85 Plantera (Otherworldly)

(Rage Of Tarunnk)

Plantera

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Plantera_(Otherworldly).mp3 A metal-like track with a sinister and somewhat gloomy feeling, appropriate for the fight against Plantera in the Underground Jungle. 86 Jungle (Otherworldly)

(Sky Guardian)

Jungle

Underground Jungle

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Jungle_(Otherworldly).mp3 A surprisingly tranquil track which seems to feature hurdy-gurdy music towards its end. The extended, enhanced version sold as part of the official Otherworld soundtrack is titled "Sky Guardian" (another name for the Wyvern) which suggests it was meant to play on Floating Islands or similar instead. 87 Wall of Flesh (Otherworldly)

The Torch God

Wall of Flesh

n/a 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Wall_of_Flesh_(Otherworldly).mp3 It is a dramatic and at times also heroic-sounding track. 88 Hallow (Otherworldly)

(Postlude - Credits)

The Hallow (surface), daytime

Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Hallow_(Otherworldly).mp3 A track which features angelic, hymn-like female vocals followed by calm piano music. It is the only in-game Otherworld track longer than 2 minutes. 89 Journey's End

During the credits

Vol. 4 1.4.1 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Journey%27s_End.mp3 A heroic, celebratory track, fit for the theme heard just after beating The Moon Lord. It includes short bits from several other tracks. 90 Deerclops

Deerclops

n/a 1.4.3 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Deerclops.mp3 This is the only non-"Otherworldly" track in the game not composed by Scott Lloyd Shelly â€“ it is instead arranged by Klei Entertainment. It is an upbeat, electronic remix of "The E.F.S. Of Winter" from Don't Starve Together. "E.F.S." stands for "Epic Fight Song".
